title: China Pact Necessary to Diversify Security Ties, Solomon Islands Says
sub_head: Prime minister says the small Pacific nation has no intention of stoking geopolitical struggle with U.S. and its allies
body:
ADELAIDE, Australia—Solomon Islands is pursuing a closer relationship with China because it no longer feels traditional partners such as Australia can meet all of its security needs, the Pacific island nation’s leader said.
Prime Minister Manasseh Sogavare said officials are ready to sign a security pact with China, rejecting criticism that it risks fueling tensions in the region. A draft of the security agreement that circulated online last week has alarmed the U.S. and Australia because it could allow China to dock naval ships in Solomon Islands and use its forces to protect the safety of Chinese citizens and major projects.
